item.title: Linux Rootkits Part 7: Hiding Processes
item.description: Now that we know how to hide directories (see last time), we can also hide processes! This is because nearly all userspace tools that give us information about processes just read the contents of the /proc/ filesystem. We can check this by looking at the output of strace -e openat ps or strace -e openat top. So, if we hide directories with the name of the PID we want to keep secret, then these userspace tools won’t notice that the process is there!
